author: potuz
content: Yeah I see it there but I think this should be definitely out of scope for this fellowship.

author: agnxsh
content: Hey everyone, I'm Agnish, a permissionless participant, recently I've been looking into several areas in EPF, I've been recently working on zkSnarks and type 1 zkrollups. Till now I've not decided what to go with here, but Verkle trees as well as Stateless AA seems quite exciting to go with.

author: bchain99
content: will join this <@476250636548308992> ! I am first working thru revising the yellow paper, read ben edingtons eth2book to its completion, along with the stuff on the reading list to get my foundation straight. I believe with that foundation I will be well qualified to tackle these problems

author: potuz
content: Yellow paper and Ben's book is quite a volume of reading!

author: bchain99
content: haha! I have already a okay-ish sense of both of them <@755590043632140352>

author: bchain99
content: just revising them, since i did mostly a lot of above the blockchain work, just want to get an idea of the lower level stuff. so that when i m working i know where to look for info. i m not completely lost

author: agnxsh
content: at it, will try to finish it as sustainably as i can

author: agnxsh
content: i am taking an approach of breaking down the essential components of the ethreum yellow paper, and going over videos/blogs/simpler notes to understand them, if there's some issue i come across while reading the yellow paper. pretty much using the yellow paper like a checklist

author: namngrg
content: Hey everyone, Naman here, participating in this cohort in a permissionless way. I have been exploring programmable cryptography and plan to work on something on the same grounds - privacy and scaling.
